question.text: Which of the following statement related to Kreb's cycle is not correct?

options.text: There is only one reaction in Kreb's cycle where FAD<sup>+</sup> is reduced to <math><msub><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></math>
During conversion of succinyl CoA to succinic acid, a molecule of GTP is synthesized.
The cycle starts with reaction of acetyl CoA with pyruvic acid to form 6C citric acid.

There are three reactions in the cycle where  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>  is reduced to  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math> .

solution.text: Kreb's cycle also known as citric acid cycle in which first reactant oxalo acetic acid (4C) reacts with Acetyl CoA (2C) to form first stable compound citric acid which is 6 carbon compound. Total 4 dehydrogenation reaction occurs in Kreb's cycle in which  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">N</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>  is hydrogen acceptor in 3 reaction and  <math><msup><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">F</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">A</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">D</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>+</mo></mrow></msup></math>  is hydrogen acceptor in one reaction.
